00015 /*!\fn LIST *new_generic_list( int max_items )
00016  *\brief Initialiaze a generic list container to max_items pointers.
00017  *\param max_items Specify a max size for the list container, 0 or negative for unlimited lists.
00018  *\return a new LIST or NULL
00019  */
00020 LIST *new_generic_list( int max_items )
00021 {
00022    LIST *list = NULL ;
00023 
00024    Malloc( list , LIST , 1 ); 
00025    __n_assert( list , return NULL );
00026 
00027    if( max_items <= 0 )
00028       list -> nb_max_items = 0 ;
00029    else
00030       list -> nb_max_items = max_items ;
00031 
00032    list -> nb_items = 0 ; 
00033    list -> start = list -> end = NULL ;
00034 
00035    return list ;
00036 } /* new_generic_list */

00040 /*!\fn LIST_NODE *new_list_node( void *ptr , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00041  *\brief Allocate a new node to link in a list.
00042  *\param ptr The pointer you want to put in the node.
00043  *\param destructor Pointer to the ptr type destructor function. Leave to NULL if there isn't.
00044  *\return A new node or NULL on error. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00045  */
00046 LIST_NODE *new_list_node( void *ptr , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00047 {
00048    LIST_NODE *node = NULL ;
00049 
00050    Malloc( node , LIST_NODE , 1 ); 
00051    __n_assert( node ,  n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error allocating node for ptr %p" , ptr ); return NULL );
00052 
00053    node -> ptr = ptr ;
00054    node -> destroy_func = destructor ;
00055    node -> next = node -> prev = NULL ;
00056 
00057    return node ;
00058 } /* new_list_node(...) */

00062 /*!\fn void *remove_list_node_f( LIST *list , LIST_NODE *node )
00063  *\brief Internal function called each time we need to get a node out of a list
00064  *\param list The list to pick in
00065  *\param node The node to remove in the list
00066  *\return The node or NULL
00067  */
00068 void *remove_list_node_f( LIST *list , LIST_NODE *node )
00069 {
00070    void *ptr = NULL ;
00071 
00072    __n_assert( list        , n_log( LOG_ERR , "can't remove from NULL list" );        return NULL );
00073    __n_assert( list->start , n_log( LOG_ERR , "can't remove from NULL list->start" ); return NULL );
00074    __n_assert( list->end   , n_log( LOG_ERR , "can't remove from NULL list->end" );   return NULL );
00075    __n_assert( node        , n_log( LOG_ERR , "can't remove from NULL node" );        return NULL );
00076 
00077    ptr = node -> ptr ;
00078    if( node -> prev && node -> next )
00079    {
00080       node -> prev -> next = node -> next ;
00081       node -> next -> prev = node -> prev ;
00082    }
00083    else
00084    {
00085       if( node -> prev == NULL && node -> next )
00086       {
00087          node -> next -> prev = NULL ;
00088          list -> start = node -> next ;
00089       }
00090       else
00091       {
00092          if( node -> prev && node -> next == NULL )
00093          {
00094             node -> prev -> next = NULL ;
00095             list -> end = node -> prev ;
00096          }
00097          else
00098          {
00099             if( node -> prev == NULL && node -> next == NULL )
00100             {
00101                /* removing last item */
00102                list -> start = list -> end = NULL ;
00103             }
00104          }
00105       }
00106    }
00107    Free( node );
00108    list -> nb_items -- ;
00109    return ptr ;
00110 } /* remove_list_node_f(...) */

00114 /*!\fn int list_push( LIST *list , void *ptr , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00115  *\brief Add a pointer to the end of the list. 
00116  *\param list An initilized list container. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00117  *\param ptr The pointer you wan to put in the list. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00118  *\param destructor Pointer to the ptr type destructor function. Leave to NULL if there isn't.
00119  *\return TRUE or FALSE. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00120  */
00121 int list_push( LIST *list , void *ptr , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) ) 
00122 {
00123    LIST_NODE *node = NULL ;
00124 
00125    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid list: NULL" ); return FALSE );
00126    __n_assert( ptr  , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid ptr: NULL" );  return FALSE );
00127 
00128    if( list -> nb_max_items > 0 && ( list -> nb_items >= list -> nb_max_items ) )
00129    {
00130       n_log( LOG_ERR , "list is full" );
00131       return FALSE ;
00132    }
00133 
00134    node = new_list_node( ptr , destructor );
00135    __n_assert( node , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Couldn't allocate new node" ); return FALSE );
00136 
00137    list -> nb_items ++ ;
00138 
00139    if( list -> end )
00140    {
00141       list -> end -> next = node ;
00142       node -> prev = list -> end ;
00143       list -> end = node ;               
00144    }
00145    else
00146    {
00147       list -> start = list -> end = node ;      
00148    }   
00149    return TRUE ;
00150 } /* list_push( ... ) */

00154 /*!\fn int list_push_sorted( LIST *list , void *ptr , int (*comparator)( const void *a , const void *b ) , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00155  *\brief Add a pointer sorted in the list , starting by the end of the list.
00156  *\param list An initilized list container. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00157  *\param ptr The pointer you wan to put in the list. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00158  *\param comparator A pointer to a function which take two void * pointers and return an int.
00159  *\param destructor Pointer to the ptr type destructor function. Leave to NULL if there isn't.
00160  *\return TRUE or FALSE. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00161  */
00162 int list_push_sorted( LIST *list , void *ptr , int (*comparator)( const void *a , const void *b ) , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00163 {
00164    LIST_NODE *nodeptr = NULL ;
00165 
00166    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid list: NULL" ); return FALSE );
00167    __n_assert( ptr  , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid ptr: NULL" );  return FALSE ); 
00168 
00169    if( list -> nb_max_items > 0 && ( list -> nb_items >= list -> nb_max_items ) )
00170    {
00171       n_log( LOG_ERR , "list is full" );
00172       return FALSE ;
00173    }
00174 
00175    if( list -> end )
00176    {
00177       nodeptr = list -> end ;
00178       while( nodeptr && ( comparator( ptr , nodeptr -> ptr ) < 0 ) )
00179          nodeptr = nodeptr -> prev ;
00180 
00181       if( !nodeptr )
00182       {
00183          /* It's the lower ranked element in the sort */
00184          list_unshift( list , ptr , destructor );
00185       }   
00186       else
00187       {
00188          /* we have a match inside the list. let's insert the datas */
00189          LIST_NODE *node_next = nodeptr -> next  ;
00190          LIST_NODE *newnode = new_list_node( ptr , destructor );
00191          __n_assert( newnode , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Couldn't allocate new node" ); return FALSE );
00192 
00193          if( node_next )
00194          {
00195             link_node( newnode , node_next );
00196          }   
00197          else 
00198             list -> end = newnode ;
00199 
00200          link_node( nodeptr , newnode );
00201          list -> nb_items ++ ;
00202       }
00203    }
00204    else
00205       list_push( list , ptr , destructor );
00206 
00207    return TRUE ;
00208 } /* list_push_sorted( ... ) */
00209

00212 /*!\fn int list_unshift( LIST *list , void *ptr , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00213  *\brief Add a pointer at the start of the list.
00214  *\param list An initilized list container. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00215  *\param ptr The pointer you wan to put in the list. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00216  *\param destructor Pointer to the ptr type destructor function. Leave to NULL if there isn't.
00217  *\return A void *ptr or NULL. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00218  */
00219 int list_unshift( LIST *list , void *ptr , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00220 {
00221    LIST_NODE *node = NULL ;
00222 
00223    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid list: NULL" ); return FALSE );
00224    __n_assert( ptr  , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid ptr: NULL" );  return FALSE );
00225 
00226    if( list -> nb_max_items > 0 && ( list -> nb_items >= list -> nb_max_items ) )
00227    {
00228       n_log( LOG_ERR , "list is full" );
00229       return FALSE ;
00230    }
00231    node = new_list_node( ptr , destructor );
00232    __n_assert( node , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Couldn't allocate new node" ); return FALSE );
00233 
00234    list -> nb_items ++ ;
00235 
00236    if( list -> start )
00237    {
00238       link_node( node , list -> start );
00239       list -> start = node ;               
00240    }
00241    else
00242    {
00243       list -> start = list -> end = node ;      
00244    }
00245 
00246    return TRUE ;
00247 } /* list_unshift_f(...) */

00251 /*!\fn int list_unshift_sorted( LIST *list , void *ptr , int (*comparator)( const void *a , const void *b ) , void (*destructor)( void *ptr )  )
00252  *\brief Add a pointer sorted in the list , starting by the start of the list.
00253  *\param list An initilized list container. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00254  *\param ptr The pointer you wan to put in the list. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00255  *\param comparator A pointer to a function which take two void * pointers and return an int.
00256  *\param destructor Pointer to the ptr type destructor function. Leave to NULL if there isn't.
00257  *\return TRUE or FALSE. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00258  */
00259 int list_unshift_sorted( LIST *list , void *ptr , int (*comparator)( const void *a , const void *b ) , void (*destructor)( void *ptr ) )
00260 {
00261    LIST_NODE *nodeptr = NULL ;
00262 
00263    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid list: NULL" ); return FALSE ); 
00264    __n_assert( ptr  , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid ptr: NULL" );  return FALSE ); 
00265 
00266    if( list -> nb_max_items > 0 && ( list -> nb_items >= list -> nb_max_items ) )
00267    {
00268       n_log( LOG_ERR , "list is full" );
00269       return FALSE ;
00270    }
00271 
00272    if( list -> start )
00273    {
00274       nodeptr = list -> start ;
00275       while( nodeptr && ( comparator( ptr , nodeptr -> ptr ) > 0 ) )
00276          nodeptr = nodeptr -> next ;
00277 
00278       if( !nodeptr )
00279       {
00280          /* It's the higher ranked element in the sort */
00281          list_push( list , ptr , destructor );
00282       }   
00283       else
00284       {
00285          /* we have a match inside the list. let's insert the datas */
00286          LIST_NODE *node_prev = nodeptr -> prev  ;
00287          LIST_NODE *newnode = new_list_node( ptr , destructor );
00288          __n_assert( newnode , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Couldn't allocate new node" ); return FALSE );
00289 
00290          if( node_prev )
00291          {   
00292             link_node( node_prev , newnode );
00293          }   
00294          else 
00295             list -> start = newnode ;
00296 
00297          link_node( newnode , nodeptr );
00298          list -> nb_items ++ ;
00299       }
00300    }
00301    else
00302       list_unshift( list , ptr , destructor );
00303 
00304    return TRUE ;
00305 } /* list_unshift_sorted(...) */

00309 /*!\fn void *list_pop_f( LIST *list ) 
00310  *\brief Get a pointer from the end of the list
00311  *\param list An initilized list container. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00312  *\return A void *ptr or NULL. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00313  */
00314 void *list_pop_f( LIST *list ) 
00315 {   
00316    LIST_NODE *nodeptr = NULL ;
00317    void *ptr = NULL ;
00318 
00319    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid list: NULL" ); return NULL );
00320 
00321    if( list -> nb_items == 0 || list -> end == NULL )
00322       return NULL ;
00323 
00324    nodeptr = list -> end ;
00325    ptr = nodeptr -> ptr ;
00326 
00327    if( list -> end -> prev )
00328    {
00329       list -> end = list -> end -> prev ;
00330       list -> end -> next = NULL ;
00331    }      
00332 
00333    list -> nb_items -- ;
00334    if( list -> nb_items == 0 )
00335       list -> start = list -> end = NULL ;
00336 
00337    Free( nodeptr );
00338 
00339    return ptr ;
00340 } /* list_pop_f( ... ) */

00344 /*!\fn void *list_shift_f( LIST *list )
00345  *\brief Get a pointer from the start of the list.
00346  *\param list An initilized list container. A null value will cause an error and a _log message.
00347  *\return A void *ptr or NULL. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00348  */
00349 void *list_shift_f( LIST *list )
00350 {
00351    LIST_NODE *nodeptr = NULL ;
00352    void *ptr = NULL ;
00353 
00354    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "invalid list: NULL" ); return NULL );
00355 
00356    if( list -> nb_items == 0 || list -> start == NULL )
00357       return NULL ;
00358 
00359    nodeptr = list -> start ;
00360    ptr = nodeptr -> ptr ;
00361 
00362    if( list -> start -> next )
00363    {
00364       list -> start = list -> start -> next ;
00365       list -> start -> prev = NULL ;
00366    }      
00367 
00368    list -> nb_items -- ;
00369 
00370    if( list -> nb_items == 0 )
00371       list -> start = list -> end = NULL ;
00372 
00373    Free( nodeptr );
00374 
00375    return ptr ;
00376 } /* list_shift_f(...)*/

00380 /*!\fn int list_empty( LIST *list )
00381  *\brief Empty a LIST list of pointers.
00382  *\param list The list to empty. An already empty or null list will cause an error and a _log message.
00383  *\return TRUE or FALSE. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00384  */
00385 int list_empty( LIST *list )
00386 {
00387    LIST_NODE *node = NULL , *node_ptr = NULL ;
00388 
00389    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "list is NULL" ); return FALSE );
00390 
00391    node = list -> start ;
00392    while( node )
00393    {
00394       node_ptr = node ;
00395       node = node -> next ;
00396       if( node_ptr -> destroy_func != NULL )
00397       {
00398          node_ptr -> destroy_func( node_ptr -> ptr );
00399       }
00400       Free( node_ptr );
00401    }
00402    list -> start = list -> end = NULL ;
00403    list -> nb_items = 0 ;
00404    return TRUE ;
00405 } /* list_empty( ... ) */
00406 
00407 
00408 
00409 /*!\fn int list_empty_with_f( LIST *list , void (*free_fnct)( void *ptr ))
00410  *\brief Empty a LIST list of pointers.
00411  *\param list The list to empty. An already empty or null list will cause an error and a _log message.
00412  *\param free_fnct a function ptr to a void func( void *ptr )
00413  *\return TRUE or FALSE. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00414  */
00415 int list_empty_with_f( LIST *list ,  void (*free_fnct)( void *ptr )  )
00416 {
00417    LIST_NODE *node = NULL , *node_ptr = NULL ;
00418    
00419    __n_assert( list , n_log( LOG_ERR , "list is NULL" ); return FALSE  );
00420                 
00421    node = list -> start ;
00422    while( node )
00423    {
00424       node_ptr = node ;
00425       node = node -> next ;
00426                   free_fnct( node_ptr -> ptr );
00427                   Free( node_ptr );
00428    }
00429    list -> start = list -> end = NULL ;
00430    list -> nb_items = 0 ;
00431    return TRUE ;
00432 } /* list_empty_with_f */

00436 /*!\fn int list_destroy( LIST **list )
00437  *\brief Empty and Free a list container. Call the destructor each time.
00438  *\param list The list to destroy. An already empty or null list will cause an error and a _log message.
00439  *\return TRUE or FALSE. Check error messages in DEBUG mode.
00440  */
00441 int list_destroy( LIST **list )
00442 {
00443    __n_assert( (*list) , n_log( LOG_ERR , "list already destroyed" ); return FALSE );
00444    list_empty( (*list) );
00445    Free( (*list ) );
00446    return TRUE ;
00447 } /* free_list( ... ) */
